title: Appalling depth of NHS crisis shows how Jeremy Hunt and Theresa May are killing a beloved institution
text:
News Opinion Appalling depth of NHS crisis shows how Jeremy Hunt and Theresa May are killing a beloved institution We must rise up and defend the health service before it’s too late Share Axeman Jeremy Hunt (Photo: PA) Share Get politics   
Shutting hospitals and closing services in them is a call to arms to defend our beloved National Health Service. 
The depth of the crisis, with two-thirds in England now in the crosshairs of hapless Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt , is a chilling indictment of a cherished public service starved of precious resources. 
Britain’s lifeline, established in 1948, is in serious danger of being severed by a heartless Conservative Government which doesn’t really care for universal medical care that is free. 
Instead of building an NHS for the 21st century, Theresa May’s Tories are slowly killing it. They know every cut that undermines public confidence will at some point inflame support for an alternative network involving charging. 
Every one of us who loves the NHS must rise up and Save Our Service before it’s too late. Like us on Facebook
